ECB staff macroeconomic projections for the euro area (Sept 2017) https://t.co/6fKlDx6bfF Annex:  https://t.co/0SYaarboeE
Draghi: All countries benefited greatly from this monetary policy
Draghi: We only have one mandate, price stability, which is inflation below but close to 2% and we're not there yet
Draghi: On inflation, we have to be confident, patient and persistent
Draghi: The incompleteness of the EMU has made the crisis more severe
Introductory statement to the press conference https://t.co/de4DpXkuqX
Draghi: There will always be deviations from the capital key due to market liquidity considerations
Draghi: Our reinvestment programme will become more sizeable
Draghi: We will be able to exploit all the flexibility of the programme
Draghi: We haven't discussed scarcity issues
Draghi: Probably the bulk of these decisions will be taken in October
Draghi: Bottom line is interest rates will remain at present levels for extended period of time and well past horizon of net asset purchases
Draghi: Pros and cons of different scenarios were discussed
Draghi: The exchange rate is not a policy target but it is very important for the medium term outlook for inflation
Draghi: We welcome the discussions on enhancing the institutional architecture of Economic and Monetary Union.
Draghi: Implementation of structural reforms needs to be substantially stepped up
Draghi: HICP projections: 1.5% in 2017 [1.5% in June], 1.2% in 2018 [1.3%], 1.5% in 2019 [1.6%]
Draghi: GDP projections: 2.2% in 2017 [1.9% in June], 1.8% in 2018 [1.8%], 1.7% in 2019 [1.7 %]
Draghi: This autumn we will decide on the calibration of our policy instruments beyond the end of the year
Draghi: If needed, we stand ready to increase our asset purchase programme in terms of size and/or duration
Draghi: Very substantial degree of accommodation still needed for underlying inflation pressures to build up and support headline inflation
Draghi: Economic expansion has yet to translate in stronger inflation dynamics. Underlying inflation remains at subdued levels.
Draghi: Recent exchange rate volatility represents a source of uncertainty which requires monitoring
Draghi: Incoming information, including new projections, confirms a broadly unchanged medium-term outlook for economic growth and inflation
Draghi: Net asset purchases to run until end of Dec 2017, or beyond, if needed, until we see a sustained adjustment in inflation
Draghi: We expect rates to remain at present levels for an extended period of time, and well past the horizon of our net asset purchases
